availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
11
The Governor pardoned Mike Sherran convicted of Manslaughter by the Fulton Equity and Criminal Court and sentenced to three years confinement in the Penitentiary
He appointed & commissioned Jas S. Whitaker Notary Public for Shelby County by and with the consent of the Senate
He remitted to Dallam Futrill $500. of a Judgment of $1000 of the Trigg Circuit Court upon a forfeited recognizance, and respited for twelve months the balance
He appointed Young A. Simm Aid with the Rank of Colonel.
He respited for twelve months the following Judgments

row.cell: Louisville City Ct vs J. Elderkin --

body.p: He remitted the following judgments, to wit:

row.cell: Louisville City Ct. vs. P. Johnson

body.p: He approved and signed enrolled bills Chapters 132. to 139 inclusive, and Resolutions Nos 5 & 6.

Feby 11.
The Governor pardoned Tho. B. Wadlington sentence to be hung by the Caldwell Circuit Court for the crime of murder Conditioned that he serve "at hard labor in the Penitentiary the balance of his natural life.
He communicated to the House of Representatives a bill originating in that House, his objections thereto. entitled "An Act to amend the charter of the Bourbon Lodge No 23 I. O. O. F.
